subject: Economics
title: Brain Drain: When the Best Minds Leave
description: A micro-lesson that makes Brain Drain: When the Best Minds Leave usable.

buildup.text: Brain drain: skilled workers migrate to rich countries for better pay and opportunities.

discovery.text: Sub-Saharan Africa has lost $2 billion worth of doctor training to emigration.

twist.text: But brain drain has a silver lining: the prospect of emigrating motivates education.

climax.text: Globalization lets talent flow to where it's best rewarded.

punchline.text: The poorest countries train the doctors that the richest countries use.

quiz.question: What is the economic impact of brain drain on developing countries?
options: Always positive because emigrants send remittances
Countries lose the human capital they invested in educating, weakening key sectors like healthcare
